void eol_button_get_stock_size ( eolUint *  w,
eolUint *  h 
)

gets the dimensions for a stock button

Parameters:
w output. if set, it will return the width of the stock button in pixels
h output. if set, it will return the height of the stock button in pixels

Definition at line 65 of file eol_component_button.c.

eolComponent* eol_button_new ( eolUint  id,
eolWord  name,
eolRectFloat  rect,
eolRect  bounds,
char *  buttonText,
eolUint  buttonType,
eolInt  buttonHotkey,
eolUint  buttonHotkeymod,
eolBool  center,
char *  buttonFileUp,
char *  buttonFileHigh,
char *  buttonFileDown,
eolVec3D  backgroundColor,
eolFloat  backgroundAlpha,
eolVec3D  highlightColor,
eolVec3D  pressColor 
)

creates a new button component

Parameters:
id the id for this component. This should be unique per window.
name the name of this component. This should be unique per window.
rect the component position relative to the window bounds
bounds the window rect.
buttonText the text to write on the button. Can be NULL
buttonType see button type enum above.
buttonHotkey the SDLKey hotkey that this button listens to. 0 or less is none
buttonHotkeymod the SDKMod that this button listens to. 0 or less is none
center if the button should be centered on the rect or aligned to it.
buttonFileUp if specified it will attempt to load this file as the button idle image
buttonFileHigh if specified it will attempt to load this file as the button highligh image
buttonFileDown if specified it will attempt to load this file as the button pressed image
backgroundColor used to set the background color for a rect button
backgroundAlpha used to set the background alpha for a rect button
highlightColor used to set the highlight color for a rect button
pressColor used to set the pressed color for a rect button

Definition at line 408 of file eol_component_button.c.

eolUint  buttonHotkeymod,

)

creates a new button component with common options

Parameters:
id the id for this component. This should be unique per window.
name the name of this component. This should be unique per window.
rect the component position relative to the window bounds
bounds the window rect.
buttonText the text to write on the button. Can be NULL
buttonType see button type enum above.
buttonHotkey the SDLKey hotkey that this button listens to. 0 or less is none
buttonHotkeymod the SDKMod that this button listens to. 0 or less is none
center if the button should be centered on the rect or aligned to it.

creates a new button component setup for use as a text button

Parameters:
id the id for this component. This should be unique per window.
name the name of this component. This should be unique per window.
rect the component position relative to the window bounds
bounds the window rect.
buttonText the text to write on the button. Can be NULL
buttonType see button type enum above.
buttonHotkey the SDLKey hotkey that this button listens to. 0 or less is none
buttonHotkeymod the SDKMod that this button listens to. 0 or less is none
center if the button should be centered on the rect or aligned to it.

Definition at line 83 of file eol_component_button.c.

eolComponent* eol_component_button_load ( eolRect  winrect,
eolKeychain *  def 
)

creates a new button component based on the config provided

Parameters:
winrect the position and size of the parent window
def a pointer to the config information for this component
Returns:
a pointer to the created and configured button component, or NULL on error.
